system.description:
This spell allows the caster to create a mass of iron, up to 500 square feet in area and up to 2 inches thick. The shape and arrangement are determined by the caster.

Creation Time:

  • Simple designs (walls, flat panels) take 1 round.
  • Moderate designs (stairs, basic structures) take 1 turn (10 rounds).
  • Complex designs (portcullises, detailed reinforcements) take up to 12 turns (2 hours), as determined by the DM.

Rules & Mechanics:

  • The iron must be one solid piece with no moving parts.
  • The caster may cast Ironform again on an existing structure to modify it for up to two hours.
  • Once finalized, the iron is permanently locked in place and cannot be further altered by Ironform.
  • The iron must rest on solid ground or a similar support.
  • Unlike Wall of Iron, the created iron does not have to be vertical.
  • The caster can form seamless joins to previously created Ironform objects.

Durability:

  • The created iron is not dispellable.
  • The iron lasts permanently unless broken or destroyed.
  • It can be destroyed by effects such as Disintegrate or by creatures like Rust Monsters.

  • According to the Fortifications Table:

    • Armor Class: -10 (2)
    • Hit Points: 15 per inch of thickness
